content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.

1->2->3->4->5->6->7

The shortest path from node 3 to node 1 is through nodes 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. Please note that the graph you provided has an edge from node 0 to node 1, but this edge is not included in the shortest path from node 3 to node 1.

1->2->3

The shortest path from node 1 to node 3 is through nodes 2 and 3. Please note that the provided graph has no edges directly connecting node 3 to the rest of the graph, so the path above is the shortest path possible given the provided information.
